intro: Trichomanes endlicherianum, commonly known as the Endlicher's maidenhair fern, is a rare and delicate fern species belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, intricately lobed fronds that are typically less than 5 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sorus, are located on the underside of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many areas.
